lines.text: Hello.
Hello, what's the thing about?
Well, boy meets girl.
Oh, I see. Well, boy loses girl.
Boy gets girl back.
Not so fast, sailor.
You're not very patriotic.
I am, but I'm not uniform-crazy.
Gunny, Sally is our child.
That's a fine time for telling me.
Why?
I've joined the the Navy again
I'll see you in four years.
Is that your daughter?
Yes, first prize at the Marathon Dance.
I guess your daddy is proud of you.
I've never seen my daddy.
Why haven't you told him?
Because someday we're gonna surprise him.
I've got a inventive mind.
*Most* sailors have.
No fooling, I've invented something right now, and if I get it working, I'll sell it to the government for plenty of dope.
What's that?
I'm crossing parrots with carrier pigeons.
What for?
So you can send verbal messages.
But Jenny, I'm your husband.
Don't remind me.
I will never join the Navy again, even if they make me a general.
Have you ever seen a general in the Navy?
No, 'cause they're smart.
Can we visit the brig? There's a man I'd like to see in it. Uh, I mean, I want to see a man who's in it.
Can we visit the crows-nest?
No, under no circumstances. It's nesting season.
What'd you join the Navy for in the first place?
On account of a woman - my wife. Two days after we were married she told me I wasn't a man of the world. So I joined the Navy.
Where will we find the Rear Admiral?
In the front office!
Oh, Captain, what a lovely submarine!
Oh yes, yes! It's the pride of the Navy!
Tell me, Captain, how long can your submarine stay under water?
Well, that all depends. Once, we submerged with the hatches open, and we didn't come up for two weeks.

[Incredulous]
Really?
Positively.
[then he and everybody else start to laugh]
I want this message delivered to Rear Admiral Stubbins of the Brooklyn Navy Yard.
Yes, sir.
I understand you were born in Brooklyn.
Yes, sir.
What part?
All of me!
I'm like olives - you gotta learn to like me.
Do you realize that marriage is a national institution and that 50% of the married people are women?

[on phone with her friend]
Oh say guess who I seen at Club Continental last night? Lucy James with that sailor she met through a Pekingese. Believe me he's a sea-goin' thrill if I ever seen one. What's he like? Well, tall - sort of the answer to a maiden's prayer on stilts. Honest he must be six feet four and that's just two inches shorter than a totem pole. Oh but he's got a smile like concentrated vodka. Vodka! Oh it's a Japanese drink made out of panther blood I think.
Say, who's little girl are you?
Mommy's girl.
He went out 15 minutes ago for 5 minutes and won't be back for a half an hour.
